meanings.definition: A U-shaped piece of wire or metal used to hold hair in place.
meanings.sent1: She secured her bun with a hairpin.
meanings.sent2: The hairstylist used a hairpin to keep the updo in place.
meanings.sent3: When the hairpin slipped out, her hair fell loose.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts took a hairpin turn as she considered a new hairstyle.
meanings.sent5: The glittering hairpin sparkled in her dark hair.

meanings.definition: A sharp bend or curve in a road or path resembling the shape of a hairpin.
meanings.sent1: The mountain road had many hairpin turns.
meanings.sent2: Drivers had to navigate the hairpin curve carefully.
meanings.sent3: The hikers were surprised by the sudden hairpin in the trail.
meanings.sent4: The river made a hairpin loop around the valley.
meanings.sent5: The hairpin bend in the road offered a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: A sharp turn or reversal in direction.
meanings.sent1: The plot of the movie took a hairpin twist.
meanings.sent2: The hairpin change in plans left everyone stunned.
meanings.sent3: Her decision to quit her job was a real hairpin moment.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation hit a hairpin when unexpected demands were made.
meanings.sent5: The hairpin shift in strategy caught the opponents off guard.
